ArticleTitle.sentence: Functional characterization of roles of GalR and GalS as regulators of the gal regulon.

AbstractText.sentence: An isorepressor of the gal regulon in Escherichia coli, GalS, has been purified to homogeneity.

In vitro DNase I protection experiments indicated that among operators of the gal regulon, GalS binds most strongly to the external operator of the mgl operon, which encodes the high-affinity beta-methylgalactoside galactose transport system, and with less affinity to the operators controlling expression of the gal operon, which codes for enzymes of galactose metabolism.

AbstractText.sentence: Consistent with the fact that GalR is the exclusive regulator of the low-affinity galactose transporter, galactose permease, and that the major role of GalS is in regulating expression of the high-affinity galactose transporter encoded by the mgl operon, we found that the DNA binding of GalS is 15-fold more sensitive than that of GalR to galactose.
